intro: Pisonia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals.
